name: Federation of European Toxicologists and European Societies of Toxicology
goal: EUROTOX aims to foster toxicology, scientifically and educationally across Europe through the annual scientific congress, workshops, and postgraduate training courses. Furthermore the annual EUROTOX awards (Merit Award and Bo Holmstedt Memorial Lecture) recognise distinguished European toxicologists. Young toxicologists are recognised by the Early Career Award, awarded every year to the best poster presentation at the EUROTOX annual Congress.
interests: Education and training, Environment, Food Safety, Public Health, Research and innovation
euInitiatives:
EUROTOX is not directly involved in the actives of influencing the development and implementation of policy, however, it actively supports specific EU regulatory framework initiatives carried out by EU agencies ECHA, EFSA and JRC.
EUROTOX board members participate in events dealing with review of EU policy (ECHA stakeholder workshop) and European Commission Expert groups (Nanomaterials NMEG). Furthermore, EUROTOX seeks to generate awareness and use of EU tools and resources among key stakeholders and the scientific community through its dissemination strategy.
Finally, the EUROTOX annual congress serves to promote key findings of projects co financed by EU programs and showcase developments and impact of EU regulation in the areas of REACH, nanomaterials, food safety, 3R/NAM, risk assessment, alternative methods, toxicology training, etc.
